title: Size & Health of the UK Space Industry 2023
note: The annual survey of the state of the UK space industry.

title: What is the government doing about space skills?
note: A summary of everything we know that the government is doing to tackle the space skills gap, focusing on activities conducted by the UK Space Agency, the MOD, and the Satellite Applications Catapult since the National Space Strategy was published in 2021.

title: Space Sector Skills Survey 2023 results
note: The findings of the Space Sector Skills Survey 2023, a major national survey to understand space skills gaps and recruitment challenges.

title: AGI Skills Survey 2023
note: The first AGI skills survey addressed issues such as recruitment, skills and retention, asking questions about barriers to employment, specific skills that are missing from existing or potential recruits and what makes people move on to new opportunities.

title: The National Space Strategy in Action
note: This policy paper sets out how the government is delivering on the ambitions set out in the National Space Strategy and summarises the government's achievements so far.

title: Size & Health of the UK Space Industry 2022
note: The annual survey of the state of the UK space industry.

title: UK space strategy and UK satellite infrastructure
note: A House of Commons Committee report, with recommendations to government, covering technology and skills.

title: Interagency Roadmap to Support Space-Related STEM Education and Workforce
note: A roadmap for US federal departments and agencies to grow, diversify, and strengthen the US space STEM workforce.

title: UK Space Agency Corporate Plan 2022-25
note: The Corporate Plan sets out the work the UK Space Agency will deliver in 2022 to 2025.

title: Our Space Our Future - Final Evaluation Report
note: The evaluation report for Our Space Our Future, a European Project that brings space science to the classroom, boosting the interest of students in space-related careers.

title: Demand for Geospatial Skills
note: Report by Frontier Economics analysing the demand for geospatial skills in the UK

title: Size & Health of the UK Space Industry 2021
note: The seventh biennial survey of the state of the UK space industry.

title: Space Education in Europe
note: An overview of the European space education landscape including an analysis of trends and challenges and a view from students and young professionals of space education in Europe.

title: 2020 State of the Canadian Space Sector Report - Facts and Figures 2019
note: A report of the state of the Canadian space industry.

title: Space/Geoinformation sector Skills Strategy report
note: This high level and strategic document set out eight goals for a long-term action plan to provide the skills needed by the European EO sector.

title: Women in the UK Space Sector
note: A report on the experiences of women in the UK space sector, drawn from the findings of the 2020 Space Census.

title: Skills Gap in the Aerospace Sector
note: A report analysing the current skills deficit in the European aerospace sector, how well graduates are meeting those needs, and the key challenges that space sector stakeholders need to overcome.

title: STEM Education In Europe
note: A concise summary of the main issues in European STEM education focusing on early inspiration, retention of young women, the contribution and influence of peers/family, and the perception of women in STEM careers.

title: Women in the C-Suite
note: A summary of the “leaky pipeline” and the issues facing women looking to advance to the C-suite which explores how governments and organisations can contribute to accelerating progress and develop and retain their top female talent.

title: Pay in the UK Space Sector
note: The first statistics on pay for the UK space sector, drawn from the findings of the 2020 Space Census.

title: National Space Strategy
note: A strategy setting out the UK government’s ambitions for the UK in space, bringing together civil and defence policy for the first time.

title: Size & Health of the UK Space Industry 2020
note: The sixth biennial survey of the state of the UK space industry.

title: Space Industry Skills Gap Analysis
note: A report for the Australian space sector identifying 319 space-related skills needed to support future needs of the sector.

title: Demographics of the UK Space Sector
note: The first comprehensive demographic statistics for the UK space sector, drawn from the findings of the 2020 Space Census.

title: Space Sector Skills Survey 2020: Research Report
note: A research report into the space industry’s recruitment and training practices.

title: Assessing the quality of space job adverts
note: An assessment of 50 job adverts from 50 space companies scored against 10 criteria based on recruitment best practice, and recommendations for improvements.

title: Towards a space competencies taxonomy
note: The first competencies taxonomy to be developed specifically for the space sector, comprising about 250 competencies across five categories.

title: Skills demand for early career space jobs
note: The first quantitative assessment of skills demand in the UK space sector, analysing 812 early career job adverts to identify competencies in highest demand.

title: 2019 Career Trends
note: A summary of space job trends in the USA based on an analysis of almost 8000 jobs.

title: 2019 Hiring Trends
note: An analysis of hiring trends at 34 space companies from around the world.

title: Space / Geospatial Sector Skills Strategy
note: A strategy for the EU to reduce the skills gap in the space and geospatial sectors and eliminate the mismatch between the supply of and the demand for education and training.

title: The Definitive Career Guide to Entrepreneurial Space
note: A guide on how to start a career in space based on advice from companies and leaders across the space sector.

title: Size & Health of the UK Space Industry 2018
note: The fifth biennial survey of the state of the UK space industry.

title: Demand for space-geospatial education and training and priority occupational profiles
note: A summary of demand for skills in the space/geospatial sector in the EU.

title: Current supply of space/geospatial education and training
note: A summary of analysis of the supply of space and geospatial education and training opportunities in the EU.

title: Prosperity from Space: A partnership strategy for the UK
note: This report sets out a vision for enhanced growth in the UK space sector over the next decade.

title: Growing the Space Economy: The Downstream Segment as a Driver
note: An analysis of the downstream space economy with a focus on South Australia.

title: Removing Roadblocks from the UK space skills pipeline: A student and young professional perspective
note: A student and young professional perspective on how to develop the space skills pipeline.

title: The impact of Brexit on the aerospace sector: Sixth Report of Session 2017–19
note: A parliamentary report on the impact of Brexit on the aerospace sector.

title: Prosperity from Space: A global partnership strategy for the UK
note: This report sets out a vision for enhanced growth in the UK space sector over the next decade.

title: Size & Health of the UK Space Industry 2016
note: The fourth biennial survey of the state of the UK space industry.

title: Importance and Challenges of Hands-On Experience in Astronautical Education
note: A discussion of the role of hands-on-activities in tertiary education with particular focus on the space sector in Europe.

title: UK Space Agency Education, Skills and Outreach Strategy
note: The strategy aims to ensure that as many young people as possible are inspired by space to study, and keep studying, STEM subjects to tertiary level ensuring a skilled and enthusiastic workforce for high tech industries (including space) in the future.

title: The impact of human spaceflight on young people’s attitudes to STEM subjects
note: A report on the impact of the education campaign linked to Tim Peake's Principia mission on young people’s attitudes to STEM subjects.

title: Space tech and services: Big Data in Earth Observation
note: An analysis of the use of 'big data' in Earth Observation and policy recommendations for improving the availability of data.

title: Growing the skills pool for the UK space sector
note: A summary presentation on actions being taken to build space skills, particularly through the National Space Academy and SPIN programme.

title: National Space Policy
note: A statement of the Government’s vision to capture a greater share of the global space market.

title: Seeking Resolution: Growing The UK Small Satellite Industry
note: A summary of the market for Earth Observation satellites, highlighting some of the barriers and opportunities facing the industry.

title: The Case for Space 2015: The impact of space on the UK economy
note: As study of the impacts of the space sector on the economy, including consumer, commercial, public sector, and national critical infrastructure applications.

title: UK Space Innovation and Growth Strategy: 2015 Update Report
note: A summary of progress against the goals set out in the 2010 Innovation and Growth Strategy, and an outline of plans for the next phase of the programme.

title: Size & Health of the UK Space Industry 2014
note: The third biennial survey of the state of the UK space industry.

title: Government Response to the UK Space Innovation and Growth Strategy 2014 – 2030
note: The government response to the pace innovation and growth strategy (IGS) action plan.

title: IGS Skills Theme Report
note: A skills-focused contribution to the Space Growth Action Plan outlining the skills landscape and current challenges, along with recommended actions for addressing these.

title: Space Innovation and Growth Strategy 2014 to 2030: Space Growth Action Plan
note: An executive summary of the updated Space Innovation and Growth Strategy report (2015).

title: Space & Aerospace Technicians
note: Report of a seminar to  explore how the supply and quality of apprenticeship training in the space and aerospace sectors could be improved.

title: Size & Health of the UK Space Industry 2012
note: The second biennial survey of the state of the UK space industry.

title: UK Space Agency Civil Space Strategy 2012-2016
note: A strategy setting out aims and objectives to strengthen the UK's position in the space sector.

title: Space for Technicians: An analysis for technician duties, skills, and training in the UK space industry
note: A study of the roles of technicians in the space sector and how employers ensure they have the technician staff they require.

title: Employer Engagement – enhancing HEI engagement with the Satellite Industry for workforce upskilling and informing policy makers
publisher: University of Reading & National HE STEM Programme
note: A review of the skill levels of graduates and apprentices entering the space sector, and the destinations of graduates from key courses compared with the skills requirements that employers report.

title: UK Space Agency Education, Skills and Outreach Strategy
note: The strategy aims to ensure that as many young people as possible are inspired by space to study, and keep studying, STEM subjects to tertiary level ensuring a skilled and enthusiastic workforce for high tech industries (including space) in the future.

title: Size & Health of the UK Space Industry 2010
note: The first biennial survey of the state of the UK space industry.

title: The Space Innovation and Growth Strategy Main Report
note: A 2020 year strategy for the space sector which identifies key trends and recommends actions industry and government need to take.

title: A UK Space Innovation and Growth Strategy 2010 to 2030
note: An executive summary of the Space Innovation and Growth Strategy report.

title: The Case for Space: The Impact of Space Derived Services and Data
note: An overview of the significant growth of space sector since 2000.
